name: Atelier Annie: Alchemists of Sera Island
summary:
The second Atelier game for the Nintendo DS and the first to be released in North America. 
The game focuses more on gathering materials and item creation than on fighting monsters.
storyline:
Annie, the main character, is a lazy girl who hates to work hard and sits around the house all day.

Finally, while Annie is asleep, her grandfather sends her off to Sera Island, where she is going to participate in a resort development project.

The next morning, she wakes to find herself in an unfamiliar room where a little boy is staring at her.

"My name is Pepe. I'm going to teach you alchemy."

Pepe tells Annie that she must participate in a resort development project by using alchemy, which she's never done before.

However, she also discovers a bit of good news. That is, the person who contributes the most to the project will win the title of Meister and will be betrothed to the Prince of Orde.

Dreaming of a wealthy future, Annie is motivated to work hard to reach her goal of marrying up.

"I'm going to win this! I'm going to be a great alchemist and marry the Prince!!"

alternative_names.name: Atelier Annie: Alchemist of Sera Island
アニーのアトリエ　～セラ島の錬金術士～

esrb.synopsis: This is a role-playing game (RPG) in which players control the central character, Annie, who is sent to an island to learn alchemy and to participate in alchemy competitions. Players traverse the island to find ingredients used to create items, while building and managing resort facilities. Players can also engage in turn-based combat with an assortment of fantastical creatures (e.g., slime monsters, lizard men, and golems). Weapon attacks and magic spells are selected from an on-screen menu; attack animations are played out and may include slashing sound effects and blinking to indicate damage inflicted. During the course of the game, some characters engage in suggestive dialogue (e.g., ". . . you have to feel sexy," "I don't think it's possible for me to have a feeling of intimacy with Mr. Kyle," and "Would you like to become my pupil and train to hunt girls?"). The expletives "dammit" and "hell" appear in the dialogue, and a weapon called "Bastard Sword" can be found in the game.
